public class AccessRuleData
extends ProtectedData
implements Serializable, Comparable<AccessRuleData>
    Deprecated.
    POJO that represents an access rule.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AccessRuleData

        public AccessRuleData​(int aPrimaryKey,
                      String anAccessRuleName,
                      AccessRuleState anInternalState,
                      boolean isRecursive)
        Deprecated.
        Creates a new instance of AccessRule.
        Parameters:
        aPrimaryKey - Primary key for this rule. Can be generated using the static method generatePrimaryKey(String, String)
        anAccessRuleName - The rule that this AccessRule should represent.
        anInternalState - The rule's state.
        isRecursive - True if the rule is recursive.

      • AccessRuleData

        public AccessRuleData​(String aRoleName,
                      String anAccessRuleName,
                      AccessRuleState anInternalState,
                      boolean isRecursive)
        Deprecated.
        Creates a new instance of AccessRule.
        Parameters:
        aRoleName - The name of the Role to which this rule belongs. Used to generate primary key.
        anAccessRuleName - The rule that this AccessRule should represent.
        anInternalState - The rule's state.
        isRecursive - True if the rule is recursive.

      • getRecursive

        public boolean getRecursive()
        Deprecated.
        This is a "combined" value of recursiveBool and recursiveInt. Used because some databases lacks a boolean type so booleanInt is a workaround to get boolean values on such databases (Ingres).
        Returns:
        boolean

      • generatePrimaryKey

        public static int generatePrimaryKey​(String roleName,
                                     String accessRuleName)
        Deprecated.
        The current pk in AdminEntityData and AccessRulesData is a mix of integer pk and constraints and actually works fine. It's used like a primitive int primary key in the db, but embeds logic for enforcing constraints, which would otherwise have to be programatically added to the beans. If needed it can easily be replaced with an int pk and programmatic logic to handle constraints. From the database view the pk is just an int.
        Parameters:
        roleName - role
        accessRuleName - rule
        Returns:
        PK

      • getProtectString

        protected String getProtectString​(int version)
        Deprecated.
        Description copied from class: ProtectedData
        asks the data class for the string to be protected. Version is -1 for a new row to be protected, and otherwise a version given earlier from the data class when storing the row.
        Specified by:
        getProtectString in class ProtectedData
        Parameters:
        version - the version of the string that is protected, used as input when verifying data. -1 when getting protection string for data to be inserted or updated. -1 means that the data class should use it's latest version of protect string
        Returns:
        String to be integrity protected, i.e. input to hmac.

      • getProtectVersion

        protected int getProtectVersion()
        Deprecated.
        Description copied from class: ProtectedData
        asks the data class for the version of the string that is protected, used as input to getProtectString() when verifying data. This is used so that the data class can alter itself with new fields, but still be backwards compatible and verify older database data. Called when getting the version for inserts or updates.
        Specified by:
        getProtectVersion in class ProtectedData
        Returns:
        int version the latest version of protection string.

      • protectData

        protected void protectData()
        Deprecated.
        Description copied from class: ProtectedData
        Overridden by extending class to be able to use @PrePersist, overriding class calls super.protectData(). This method creates integrity protection for the specific entity in the database.
        Overrides:
        protectData in class ProtectedData

      • verifyData

        protected void verifyData()
        Deprecated.
        Description copied from class: ProtectedData
        Overridden by extending class to be able to use @PostLoad, overriding class calls super.verifyData(). This method verifies integrity protection for the specific entity in the database. If the data verification failed, it invokes ProtectedData.onDataVerificationError(DatabaseProtectionException).
        Overrides:
        verifyData in class ProtectedData

      • getRowId

        protected String getRowId()
        Deprecated.
        Description copied from class: ProtectedData
        Returns id of the row in the database, in case of failure we can see in the log which row failed to verify.
        Specified by:
        getRowId in class ProtectedData
        Returns:
        id of database row, specific for implementing class.
